The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of the carrot family. Chaptalia species are native to regions of South America, particularly in the Andes, where they thrive in high-altitude environments. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
